Title.Language: Psali Adam for the Martyrdom of Saints Apakir and John

Text.Language: Al/ywc tennah]: e~rok w~ penn/b Pi,~rictoc: nai nan eybe ]macnou]: nem nia~gioc a~pa Kir nem Iwann/c.
Truly, we believe in You,Â / O Christ our Master,Â / have mercy on us for the sake of the Mother of GodÂ / and Saints Abakir and John.

Everyone honorsÂ / the struggle-mantledÂ / victorious soldiers,Â / Saints Abakir and John.

Title.Language: Psali Watos for the Martyrdom of Saints Apakir and John

Text.Language: Amwini t/rou n~tenhwc: m~Pen[oic I/couc Pi,~rictoc: n~tentaio~ n~nia~gioc: a~pa Kir nem Iwann/c nimarturoc.
Come all, to praiseÂ / our Lord, Jesus Christ,Â / and honor the martyrs,Â / Saints Abakir and John.

Baki niben n~te nipictoc: nem sasf n~tagma n~ekkl/cia: eurasi qen p~sai n~nigenneoc: nimarturoc sa ]cuntelia.
Every city of the faithful,Â / and the seven Church orders,Â / rejoice on the feast of the heroes,Â / the martyrs until the end.

All the Christians gatherÂ / diligently at the commemorationÂ / of the struggle-mantled martyrs,Â / Abakir and John.

David said in the psalm,Â / and spoke of the honor of the martyrs:Â / â€œHonorable before the LordÂ / is the death of the saints in Christ.â€?

Who among the wiseÂ / and the scholars of this worldÂ / can utter the honor of the martyrs,Â / Abakir and John the heroes.

Many are the wonders and powersÂ / that the physicians didÂ / for the sake of Christ,Â / the King of Glory.

Gather all, O beloved,Â / the children of the Orthodox,Â / to honor in every way,Â / Abakir and John the martyrs.
